metadata.name: Configure server restrictions for ntpd
metadata.description:
ntpd is a daemon which implements the Network Time Protocol (NTP). It is designed to synchronize system clocks across a variety of systems and use a source that is highly accurate. More information on NTP can be found at {{{ weblink(link="http://www.ntp.org")}}}. ntp can be configured to be a client and/or a server. To ensure that ntpd implements correct server restrictions, make sure that the following lines exist in the file /etc/ntpd.conf: 
restrict -4 default kod nomodify notrap nopeer noquery
restrict -6 default kod nomodify notrap nopeer noquery
This recommendation only applies if ntp is in use on the system.
metadata.rationale:
If ntp is in use on the system proper configuration is vital to ensuring time synchronization
is working properly.
